snippet: With its alternative to the Common Application, a group of selective colleges hopes to unearth a more “authentic” applicant as well as improve access. Some say it will merely up the ante.
abstract: Coalition for Access, Affordability and Success, which is led by admissions deans at top campuses, helps prepare high schools students through arduous college application process starting freshmen year with free online planning tools; coalition receives negative and positive response from educators.
lead_paragraph: With its alternative to the Common Application, a group of selective colleges hopes to unearth a more “authentic” applicant as well as improve access. Some say it will merely up the ante.

headline.main: A New Coalition of Elite Colleges Tries to Reshape Admissions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Coalition for Access, Affordability and Success
